paragraph: The Tale of Jemima Puddle-Duck Beatrix Potter
A FARMYARD TALE     FOR     RALPH AND BETSY
tokens: tale

paragraph: BOOK 1.
What a funny sight it is to see a brood of ducklings with a hen!
tokens: funny sight see brood duckling hen

paragraph: --Listen to the story of Jemima Puddle-duck, who was annoyed because the farmer's wife would not let her hatch her own eggs.
tokens: listen story duck annoyed farmer wife let hatch own egg

paragraph: Her sister-in-law, Mrs. Rebeccah Puddle-duck, was perfectly willing to leave the hatching to some one else--"I have not the patience to sit on a nest for twenty-eight days; and no more have you, Jemima. You would let them go cold; you know you would!"
tokens: sister law duck willing leave hatching one else have patience sit nest day have let go cold know

paragraph: "I wish to hatch my own eggs; I will hatch them all by myself," quacked Jemima Puddle-duck.
tokens: wish hatch own egg hatch quack duck

paragraph: She tried to hide her eggs; but they were always found and carried off.
tokens: try hide egg find carry

paragraph: Jemima Puddle-duck became quite desperate. She determined to make a nest right away from the farm.
tokens: duck become desperate determine make nest farm

paragraph: She set off on a fine spring afternoon along the cart-road that leads over the hill.
tokens: set fine spring afternoon cart road lead hill

paragraph: She was wearing a shawl and a poke bonnet.
tokens: wear shawl poke bonnet

paragraph: When she reached the top of the hill, she saw a wood in the distance.
tokens: reach top hill see wood distance

paragraph: She thought that it looked a safe quiet spot.
tokens: think look safe quiet spot

paragraph: Jemima Puddle-duck was not much in the habit of flying. She ran downhill a few yards flapping her shawl, and then she jumped off into the air.
tokens: duck habit fly run few yard flap shawl jump air

paragraph: She flew beautifully when she had got a good start.
tokens: fly get good start

paragraph: She skimmed along over the tree-tops until she saw an open place in the middle of the wood, where the trees and brushwood had been cleared.
tokens: skimm tree top see open place middle wood tree brushwood clear

paragraph: Jemima alighted rather heavily, and began to waddle about in search of a convenient dry nesting-place. She rather fancied a tree-stump amongst some tall fox-gloves.
tokens: alight begin waddle search convenient dry nest place fancy tree stump tall fox glove

paragraph: But--seated upon the stump, she was startled to find an elegantly dressed gentleman reading a newspaper.
tokens: seat stump startle find dress gentleman read newspaper

paragraph: He had black prick ears and sandy coloured whiskers.
tokens: have black prick ear sandy coloured whisker

paragraph: "Quack?" said Jemima Puddle-duck, with her head and her bonnet on one side--"Quack?"
tokens: quack say duck head bonnet side quack

paragraph: The gentleman raised his eyes above his newspaper and looked curiously at Jemima--
tokens: gentleman raise eye newspaper look

paragraph: "Madam, have you lost your way?" said he. He had a long bushy tail which he was sitting upon, as the stump was somewhat damp.
tokens: lose way say have long bushy tail sit stump damp

paragraph: Jemima thought him mighty civil and handsome. She explained that she had not lost her way, but that she was trying to find a convenient dry nesting-place.
tokens: think mighty civil handsome explain lose way try find convenient dry nest place

paragraph: "Ah! is that so? indeed!" said the gentleman with sandy whiskers, looking curiously at Jemima. He folded up the newspaper, and put it in his coat-tail pocket.
tokens: say gentleman sandy whisker look fold newspaper put coat tail pocket

paragraph: Jemima complained of the superfluous hen.
tokens: complain superfluous hen

paragraph: "Indeed! how interesting! I wish I could meet with that fowl. I would teach it to mind its own business!"
tokens: interesting wish meet fowl teach mind own business

paragraph: "But as to a nest--there is no difficulty: I have a sackful of feathers in my wood-shed. No, my dear madam, you will be in nobody's way. You may sit there as long as you like," said the bushy long-tailed gentleman.
tokens: nest be difficulty have sackful feather wood shed dear madam way sit like say bushy long tail gentleman

paragraph: He led the way to a very retired, dismal-looking house amongst the fox-gloves.
tokens: lead way retire dismal look house fox glove

paragraph: It was built of faggots and turf, and there were two broken pails, one on top of another, by way of a chimney.
tokens: build faggot turf be break pail top way chimney

paragraph: "This is my summer residence; you would not find my earth--my winter house--so convenient," said the hospitable gentleman.
tokens: summer residence find earth winter house convenient say hospitable gentleman

paragraph: There was a tumble-down shed at the back of the house, made of old soap-boxes. The gentleman opened the door, and showed Jemima in.
tokens: be tumble shed back house make old soap box gentleman open door show

paragraph: The shed was almost quite full of feathers--it was almost suffocating; but it was comfortable and very soft.
tokens: shed full feather suffocate comfortable soft

paragraph: Jemima Puddle-duck was rather surprised to find such a vast quantity of feathers. But it was very comfortable; and she made a nest without any trouble at all.
tokens: duck surprised find vast quantity feather comfortable make nest trouble

paragraph: When she came out, the sandy whiskered gentleman was sitting on a log reading the newspaper--at least he had it spread out, but he was looking over the top of it.
tokens: come sandy whiskered gentleman sit log read newspaper least have spread look top

paragraph: He was so polite, that he seemed almost sorry to let Jemima go home for the night. He promised to take great care of her nest until she came back again next day.
tokens: polite seem sorry let go night promise take great care nest come next day

paragraph: He said he loved eggs and ducklings; he should be proud to see a fine nestful in his wood-shed.
tokens: say love egg duckling proud see fine nestful wood shed

paragraph: Jemima Puddle-duck came every afternoon; she laid nine eggs in the nest. They were greeny white and very large. The foxy gentleman admired them immensely. He used to turn them over and count them when Jemima was not there.
tokens: duck come afternoon lay egg nest greeny white large foxy gentleman admire use turn count

paragraph: At last Jemima told him that she intended to begin to sit next day--"and I will bring a bag of corn with me, so that I need never leave my nest until the eggs are hatched. They might catch cold," said the conscientious Jemima.
tokens: last tell intend begin sit next day bring bag corn leave nest egg hatch catch cold say conscientious

paragraph: "Madam, I beg you not to trouble yourself with a bag; I will provide oats. But before you commence your tedious sitting, I intend to give you a treat. Let us have a dinner-party all to ourselves!
tokens: beg trouble bag provide oat commence tedious sitting intend give treat let have dinner party

paragraph: "May I ask you to bring up some herbs from the farm-garden to make a savoury omelette? Sage and thyme, and mint and two onions, and some parsley. I will provide lard for the stuff--lard for the omelette," said the hospitable gentleman with sandy whiskers.
tokens: ask bring herb farm garden make savoury omelette sage thyme mint onion parsley provide lard stuff lard omelette say hospitable gentleman sandy whisker

paragraph: Jemima Puddle-duck was a simpleton: not even the mention of sage and onions made her suspicious.
tokens: duck simpleton mention sage onion make suspicious

paragraph: She went round the farm-garden, nibbling off snippets of all the different sorts of herbs that are used for stuffing roast duck.
tokens: go farm garden nibble snippet different sort herb use stuff roast duck

paragraph: And she waddled into the kitchen, and got two onions out of a basket.
tokens: waddle kitchen get onion basket

paragraph: The collie-dog Kep met her coming out, "What are you doing with those onions? Where do you go every afternoon by yourself, Jemima Puddle-duck?"
tokens: collie dog meet come do onion go afternoon duck

paragraph: Jemima was rather in awe of the collie; she told him the whole story.
tokens: awe collie tell whole story

paragraph: The collie listened, with his wise head on one side; he grinned when she described the polite gentleman with sandy whiskers.
tokens: collie listen wise head side grin describe polite gentleman sandy whisker

paragraph: He asked several questions about the wood, and about the exact position of the house and shed.
tokens: ask several question wood exact position house shed

paragraph: Then he went out, and trotted down the village. He went to look for two fox-hound puppies who were out at walk with the butcher.
tokens: go trotet village go look fox hound puppy walk butcher

paragraph: Jemima Puddle-duck went up the cart-road for the last time, on a sunny afternoon. She was rather burdened with bunches of herbs and two onions in a bag.
tokens: puddle duck go cart road last time sunny afternoon burden bunch herb onion bag

paragraph: She flew over the wood, and alighted opposite the house of the bushy long-tailed gentleman.
tokens: fly wood alight house bushy long tail gentleman

paragraph: He was sitting on a log; he sniffed the air, and kept glancing uneasily round the wood. When Jemima alighted he quite jumped.
tokens: sit log sniff air keep glance wood alight jump

paragraph: "Come into the house as soon as you have looked at your eggs. Give me the herbs for the omelette. Be sharp!"
tokens: come house look egg give herb omelette sharp

paragraph: He was rather abrupt. Jemima Puddle-duck had never heard him speak like that.
tokens: abrupt duck hear speak

paragraph: She felt surprised, and uncomfortable.
tokens: feel surprise uncomfortable

paragraph: While she was inside she heard pattering feet round the back of the shed. Some one with a black nose sniffed at the bottom of the door, and then locked it.
tokens: hear pattering foot back shed one black nose sniff bottom door lock

paragraph: Jemima became much alarmed.
tokens: become alarm

paragraph: A moment afterwards there were most awful noises--barking, baying, growls and howls, squealing and groans.
tokens: moment be awful noise barking baying growl howl squeal groan

paragraph: And nothing more was ever seen of that foxy-whiskered gentleman.
tokens: more see foxy whiskered gentleman

paragraph: Presently Kep opened the door of the shed, and let out Jemima Puddle-duck.
tokens: open door shed let duck

paragraph: Unfortunately the puppies rushed in and gobbled up all the eggs before he could stop them.
tokens: puppy rush gobble egg stop

paragraph: He had a bite on his ear and both the puppies were limping.
tokens: have bite ear puppy limp

paragraph: Jemima Puddle-duck was escorted home in tears on account of those eggs.
tokens: duck escort tear account egg

paragraph: She laid some more in June, and she was permitted to keep them herself: but only four of them hatched.
tokens: lay more permit keep hatch

paragraph: Jemima Puddle-duck said that it was because of her nerves; but she had always been a bad sitter.
tokens: puddle duck say nerve bad sitter
